channel.title: Thunderbird / enigmail no longer installed / sudo apt-get dist-upgrade - The following packages will be REMOVED: enigmail
channel.description:
This is happening on a Qubes debian-9 VM for me. So this could be a Debian issue. By extension, Whonix would be affected as well.
user@debian-9:~$ sudo apt-get dist-upgrade Reading package lists... Done Building dependency tree Reading state information... Done Calculating upgrade... Done The following packages will be REMOVED: enigmail The following packages will be upgraded: ghostscript icedove libgs9 libgs9-common libmarkdown2 lightning thunderbird 7 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 1 to remove and 0 not upgraded. Need to get 44.5 MB of archives. After this operation, 28.4 MB of additional disk space will be used. Do you want to continue? [Y/n]

item.title: Thunderbird / enigmail no longer installed / sudo apt-get dist-upgrade - The following packages will be REMOVED: enigmail
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Thunderbird no longer installed by default Development
@Patrick I don’t know if it’s been reported but I noticed XFCE releases are missing the thunderbird and enigmail packages.

Read full topic

item.description:
it appears to be fixed now in the debian repos. enigmail can be installed again via apt-get.

item.title: Thunderbird / enigmail no longer installed / sudo apt-get dist-upgrade - The following packages will be REMOVED: enigmail
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Above is a duplicate. Debian is aware of the issue. See:

Enigmail 2.0 needed in Stretch after Thunderbird 60 upload
https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=909000

item.title: Thunderbird / enigmail no longer installed / sudo apt-get dist-upgrade - The following packages will be REMOVED: enigmail
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
Patrick:

Packages thunderbird enigmail torbirdy can be removed. We’ll reinstall them later most likely. A Debian bug report may be required if there is none already to get this sorted in Debain.

solving this for users who will ask about it:

download TorBirdy + Engimail manually:

  • TorBirdy
  • Enigmail

After that open ThunderBird and follow the images:

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:

Hit:3 tor+http://sgvtcaew4bxjd7ln.onion stretch/updates InRelease                                                                              
Ign:4 tor+http://vwakviie2ienjx6t.onion/debian stretch InRelease                      
Hit:5 tor+http://vwakviie2ienjx6t.onion/debian stretch Release
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree       
Reading state information... Done
3 packages can be upgraded. Run 'apt list --upgradable' to see them.

item.title: Thunderbird / enigmail no longer installed / sudo apt-get dist-upgrade - The following packages will be REMOVED: enigmail
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Will take some time for Whonix meta package upgrades to be released.

For now just wait.

github.com/Whonix/anon-meta-packages

remove thunderbird, enigmail, xul-ext-torbirdy (dependency issues)

by adrelanos on 07:55AM - 17 Sep 18 UTC
changed 1 files with 1 additions and 1 deletions.

Read full topic

item.title: Thunderbird / enigmail no longer installed / sudo apt-get dist-upgrade - The following packages will be REMOVED: enigmail
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
This is happening on a Qubes debian-9 VM for me. So this could be a Debian issue. By extension, Whonix would be affected as well.

user@debian-9:~$ sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree       
Reading state information... Done
Calculating upgrade... Done
The following packages will be REMOVED:
  enigmail
The following packages will be upgraded:
  ghostscript icedove libgs9 libgs9-common libmarkdown2 lightning thunderbird
7 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 1 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
Need to get 44.5 MB of archives.
After this operation, 28.4 MB of additional disk space will be used.
Do you want to continue? [Y/n]

Read full topic
